unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Science Scale Miscalibration
question_text: A science teacher has students measure the mass of their personal science notebooks using the same scale. The resulting mean and standard deviation are $130\text{ grams}$ and $5\text{ grams}$ , respectively. The teacher later realizes that the scale used by students to measure the notebooks was not calibrated properly. The masses of the notebooks registered as $2\text{ grams}$ more than they should have been. Without remeasuring all the notebooks, what values should the teacher use for the mean and standard deviation of these values?

choices.text: μ = 128 grams μ = 128 grams ; σ = 5 grams σ = 5 grams
μ = 128 grams μ = 128 grams ; σ = 3 grams σ = 3 grams
μ = 128 grams μ = 128 grams ; Standard deviation cannot be determined.
μ = 132 grams μ = 132 grams ; σ = 5 grams σ = 5 grams
μ = 132 grams μ = 132 grams ; σ = 3 grams σ = 3 grams
